channel.title: Need help: Starting location
channel.description:
Hi, i've looked around and can't find any tutorials for this.
I'm not sure on what the source im using is... whether it be 317, Delta, or anything else :rolleyes:
I'm not sure on how I change the starting location, as the Co-ords for new characters are never the same (I think it's like a small specific area that you log in too...) and so i'm not sure on the Co-Ords to search for, plus I don't have a login.JAVA.
Don't suppose anyone would be able to help? I'll rep people who help :)

item.title: Need help: Starting location
item.dc:creator: @daved daved
item.description:
@daved wrote:

This thingie doesn’t work Failed!

Read full topic

item.title: Need help: Starting location
item.dc:creator: @noobie22 Noobie22
item.description:
@noobie22 wrote:

Just change the log-in coords.

Here. My own TuT.

First open client class.

Search:

characterfile.write(Integer.toString(absY == -1 ? 3500 : absY), 0, Integer.toString(absY == -1 ? 3500 : absY).length());

Change the absY == -1 ? 3500 : absY

To the absY co’ord you want.
You have to do this twice, so it should look like this:

characterfile.write(Integer.toString(absY == -1 ? #### : absY), 0, Integer.toString(absY == -1 ? #### : absY).length());
Step 2.

Search

characterfile.write(Integer.toString(absX == -1 ? 3088 : absX), 0, Integer.toString(absX == -1 ? 3088 : absX).length());

But upwards.

Change the absX co’ord to the one you want.

characterfile.write(Integer.toString(absX == -1 ? #### : absX), 0, Integer.toString(absX == -1 ? #### : absX).length());

Read full topic
